column4: hey eveyone. I am using Ubuntu intrepid, english version . I have some russian music with file and folder names in Cyrillic alphabet
they are displayed correctly in nautilus, but Amarok makes a mess of the artist and album names
any clue why amarok doesn't display them correctly?
you probably have to convert them from windows-1251 into utf-8
the id3 tags? How could I do that?
install python-mutagen package, and run the following command in the directory with music: 'find ./ -iname '*.mp3' -print0 | xargs -0 mid3iconv -e CP1251 --remove-v1'
I know, it doesn't look good, but this is the fastest may, imho
Not at all. You may try it in a separate directory first.
just in case, although it always worked for me
:) I have a backup of the music

:) I've actually created a small script called convtags, and put it in the search path. So, not I merely have to go to the new music directory, and run the convtags command. Now my tags are displayed correctly everywhere.
you are a hero :) Just converted the id3 tags of 1.7GB of mp3's
